   20: -module(erl_eval_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   24: 
   25: -export([guard_1/1, guard_2/1,
   26: 	 match_pattern/1,
   27: 	 match_bin/1,
   28: 	 string_plusplus/1,
   29: 	 pattern_expr/1,
   30:          guard_3/1, guard_4/1, guard_5/1,
   31:          lc/1,
   32:          zlc/1,
   33:          zbc/1,
   34:          zmc/1,
   35:          simple_cases/1,
   36:          unary_plus/1,
   37:          apply_atom/1,
   38:          otp_5269/1,
   39:          otp_6539/1,
   40:          otp_6543/1,
   41:          otp_6787/1,
   42:          otp_6977/1,
   43: 	 otp_7550/1,
   44:          otp_8133/1,
   45:          otp_10622/1,
   46:          otp_13228/1,
   47:          otp_14826/1,
   48:          funs/1,
   49:          custom_stacktrace/1,

   52: 	 zero_width/1,

   65: 
   66: %%
   67: %% Define to run outside of test server
   68: %%
   69: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   70: 
   71: -import(lists,[concat/1, sort/1]).
   72: 
   73: -export([count_down/2, count_down_fun/0, do_apply/2,
   74:          local_func/3, local_func_value/2]).
   75: -export([simple/0]).
   76: -export([my_div/2]).
   77: 
   78: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   79: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   80: -export([config/2]).
   81: -define(line, noop, ).
   82: config(priv_dir,_) ->
   83:     ".".
   84: -else.
   85: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   86: -endif.
   87: 
   88: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   92:     ok.
   93: 
   94: suite() ->
   95:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   96:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   97: 
   98: all() ->
   99:     [guard_1, guard_2, match_pattern, string_plusplus,
  100:      pattern_expr, match_bin, guard_3, guard_4, guard_5, lc,
  101:      simple_cases, unary_plus, apply_atom, otp_5269,
  102:      otp_6539, otp_6543, otp_6787, otp_6977, otp_7550,
  103:      otp_8133, otp_10622, otp_13228, otp_14826,
  104:      funs, custom_stacktrace, try_catch, eval_expr_5, zero_width,
  105:      eep37, eep43, otp_15035, otp_16439, otp_14708, otp_16545, otp_16865,
  106:      eep49, binary_and_map_aliases, eep58, strict_generators, binary_skip,
  107:      zlc, zbc, zmc].
  108: 
  109: groups() ->
  110:     [].
  111: 
  112: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  113:     Config.
  114: 
  115: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  119:     Config.
  120: 
  121: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  122:     Config.
  123: 
  124: %% OTP-2405
  125: guard_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  127: 	erl_scan:string("if a+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end. "),
  128:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  129:     no = guard_1_compiled(),
  130:     {value, no, []} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: guard_1_compiled() ->
  134:     if a+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end.
  135: 
  136: %% Similar to guard_1, but type-correct.
  137: guard_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  139: 	erl_scan:string("if 6+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end. "),
  140:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  141:     no = guard_2_compiled(),
  142:     {value, no, []} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: guard_2_compiled() ->
  146:     if 6+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end.
  147: 
  148: %% OTP-3069: syntactic sugar string ++ ...
  149: string_plusplus(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  150:     check(fun() -> case "abc" of "ab" ++ L -> L end end,
  151: 	  "case \"abc\" of \"ab\" ++ L -> L end. ",
  152: 	  "c"),
  153:     check(fun() -> case "abcde" of "ab" ++ "cd" ++ L -> L end end,
  154: 	  "case \"abcde\" of \"ab\" ++ \"cd\" ++ L -> L end. ",
  155: 	  "e"),
  156:     check(fun() -> case "abc" of [97, 98] ++ L -> L end end,
  157: 	  "case \"abc\" of [97, 98] ++ L -> L end. ",
  158: 	  "c"),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: %% OTP-2983: match operator in pattern.
  162: match_pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  163:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of {a, _X}=Y -> {x,Y} end end,
  164: 	  "case {a, b} of {a, X}=Y -> {x,Y} end. ",
  165: 	  {x, {a, b}}),
  166:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of Y={a, _X} -> {x,Y} end end,
  167: 	  "case {a, b} of Y={a, X} -> {x,Y} end. ",
  168: 	  {x, {a, b}}),
  169:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of Y={a, _X}=Z -> {Z,Y} end end,
  170: 	  "case {a, b} of Y={a, X}=Z -> {Z,Y} end. ",
  171: 	  {{a, b}, {a, b}}),
  172:     check(fun() -> A = 4, B = 28, <<13:(A+(X=B))>>, X end,
  173: 	  "begin A = 4, B = 28, <<13:(A+(X=B))>>, X end.",
  174: 	  28),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: %% Binary match problems.
  178: match_bin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     check(fun() -> <<"abc">> = <<"abc">> end,
  180: 	  "<<\"abc\">> = <<\"abc\">>. ",
  181: 	  <<"abc">>),
  182:     check(fun() ->
  183: 		  <<Size,B:Size/binary,Rest/binary>> = <<2,"AB","CD">>,
  184: 		  {Size,B,Rest}
  185: 	  end,
  186: 	  "begin <<Size,B:Size/binary,Rest/binary>> = <<2,\"AB\",\"CD\">>, "
  187: 	  "{Size,B,Rest} end. ",
  188: 	  {2,<<"AB">>,<<"CD">>}),
  189:     ok.
  190: 
  191: %% OTP-3144: compile-time expressions in pattern.
  192: pattern_expr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     check(fun() -> case 4 of 2+2 -> ok end end,
  194: 	  "case 4 of 2+2 -> ok end. ",
  195: 	  ok),
  196:     check(fun() -> case 2 of +2 -> ok end end,
  197: 	  "case 2 of +2 -> ok end. ",
  198: 	  ok),
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: %% OTP-4518.
  202: guard_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  203:     check(fun() -> if false -> false; true -> true end end,
  204: 	  "if false -> false; true -> true end.",
  205: 	  true),
  206:     check(fun() -> if <<"hej">> == <<"hopp">> -> true;
  207: 		      true -> false end end,
  208: 	  "begin if <<\"hej\">> == <<\"hopp\">> -> true;
  209:                           true -> false end end.",
  210:                 false),
  211:     check(fun() -> if <<"hej">> == <<"hej">> -> true;
  212: 		      true -> false end end,
  213: 	  "begin if <<\"hej\">> == <<\"hej\">> -> true;
  214:                           true -> false end end.",
  215:                 true),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %% OTP-4885.
  219: guard_4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  220:     check(fun() -> if erlang:'+'(3,a) -> true ; true -> false end end,
  221: 	  "if erlang:'+'(3,a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  222: 	  false),
  223:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_integer(3) -> true ; true -> false end
  224: 	  end,
  225: 	  "if erlang:is_integer(3) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  226: 	  true),
  227:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3], erlang:is_integer(X)] end,
  228: 	  "[X || X <- [1,2,3], erlang:is_integer(X)].",
  229: 	  [1,2,3]),
  230:     check(fun() -> if is_atom(is_integer(a)) -> true ; true -> false end
  231: 	  end,
  232: 	  "if is_atom(is_integer(a)) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  233: 	  true),
  234:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_atom(erlang:is_integer(a)) -> true;
  235: 		      true -> false end end,
  236: 	  "if erlang:is_atom(erlang:is_integer(a)) -> true; "
  237: 	  "true -> false end.",
  238: 	  true),
  239:     check(fun() -> if is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end end,
  240: 	  "if is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  241: 	  false),
  242:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end
  243: 	  end,
  244: 	  "if erlang:is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  245: 	  false),
  246:     ok.
  247: 
  248: %% Guards with erlang:'=='/2.
  249: guard_5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  250:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  251: 	erl_scan:string("case 1 of A when erlang:'=='(A, 1) -> true end."),
  252:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  253:     true = guard_5_compiled(),
  254:     {value, true, [{'A',1}]} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  255:     ok.
  256: 
  257: guard_5_compiled() ->
  258:     case 1 of A when erlang:'=='(A, 1) -> true end.
  259: 
  260: %% OTP-4518.
  261: lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  262:     check(fun() -> X = 32, [X || X <- [1,2,3]] end,
  263: 	  "begin X = 32, [X || X <- [1,2,3]] end.",
  264: 	  [1,2,3]),
  265:     check(fun() -> X = 32,
  266: 		   [X || <<X:X>> <- [<<1:32>>,<<2:32>>,<<3:8>>]] end,
  267: 	  %% "binsize variable"          ^
  268: 	  "begin X = 32,
  269:                  [X || <<X:X>> <- [<<1:32>>,<<2:32>>,<<3:8>>]] end.",
  270:                 [1,2]),
  271:     check(fun() -> Y = 13,[X || {X,Y} <- [{1,2}]] end,
  272: 	  "begin Y = 13,[X || {X,Y} <- [{1,2}]] end.",
  273: 	  [1]),
  274:     error_check("begin [A || X <- [{1,2}], 1 == A] end.",
  275: 		{unbound_var,'A'}),
  276:     error_check("begin X = 32,
  277:                         [{Y,W} || X <- [1,2,32,Y=4], Z <- [1,2,W=3]] end.",
  278:                       {unbound_var,'Y'}),
  279:     error_check("begin X = 32,<<A:B>> = <<100:X>> end.",
  280: 		{unbound_var,'B'}),
  281:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3,4], not (X < 2)] end,
  282: 	  "begin [X || X <- [1,2,3,4], not (X < 2)] end.",
  283: 	  [2,3,4]),
  284:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [true,false], X] end,
  285: 	  "[X || X <- [true,false], X].", [true]),
  286:     ok.
  287: 
  288: %% EEP-73 zip generator.
  289: zlc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  290:     check(fun() ->
  291:                   X = 32, Y = 32, [{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3] && Y <- [4,5,6]]
  292:           end,
  293:           "begin X = 32, Y = 32, [{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3] && Y <- [4,5,6]] end.",
  294:           [{1,4},{2,5},{3,6}]),
  295:     check(fun() ->
  296:                   S1 = [x, y, z], S2 = [5, 10, 15], X = 32, Y = 32,
  297:                   [{X, Y} || X <- S1 && Y <- S2]
  298:           end,
  299:           "begin
  300:         S1 = [x, y, z], S2 = [5, 10, 15], X = 32, Y = 32,
  301:           [{X, Y} || X <- S1 && Y <- S2]
  302:           end.",
  303:     [{x,5}, {y,10}, {z,15}]),
  304:     check(fun() ->
  305:                   [{X, Y, K} || X <:- [1,2,3] &&  Y:=K <- #{1=>a, 2=>b, 3=>c}]
  306:           end,
  307:           "begin [{X, Y, K} || X <:- [1,2,3] &&  Y:=K <- #{1=>a, 2=>b, 3=>c}] end.",
  308:           [{1,1,a},{2,2,b},{3,3,c}]),
  309:     check(fun() ->
  310:                 [{X, W+Y} || X <- [a, b, c] && <<Y>> <= <<2, 4, 6>>, W <- [1,2]]
  311:         end,
  312:         "begin [{X, W+Y} || X <- [a, b, c] && <<Y>> <= <<2, 4, 6>>, W <- [1,2]] end.",
  313:         [{a,3}, {a,4}, {b,5}, {b,6}, {c,7}, {c,8}]),
  314:     check(fun() ->
  315:             [{X, W+Y} || W <- [0], X <- [a, b, c] && <<Y>> <:= <<2, 4, 6>>, Y<4]
  316:     end,
  317:     "begin [{X, W+Y} || W <- [0], X <- [a, b, c] && <<Y>> <:= <<2, 4, 6>>, Y<4] end.",
  318:     [{a,2}]),
  319:     check(fun() ->
  320:             [{X,Y}|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && Y <-[1,2]] end,
  321:         "begin [{X,Y}|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && Y <-[1,2]] end.",
  322:         []),
  323:     check(fun() ->
  324:         [{A,B,W} || {Same,W} <- [{a,1}],
  325:             {Same,A} <- [{a,1},{b,9},{x,10}] && {Same,B} <- [{a,7},{wrong,8},{x,20}]]
  326:         end,
  327:         "begin [{A,B,W} || {Same,W} <- [{a,1}],
  328:             {Same,A} <- [{a,1},{b,9},{x,10}] && {Same,B} <- [{a,7},{wrong,8},{x,20}]]
  329:         end.",
  330:         [{1,7,1},{10,20,1}]),
  331:     error_check("[X || X <- a && Y <- [1]].",{bad_generators,{a,[1]}}),
  332:     error_check("[{X,Y} || X <- a && <<Y>> <= <<1,2>>].",{bad_generators,{a,<<1,2>>}}),
  333:     error_check("[{X,V} || X <- a && _K := V <- #{b=>3}].",{bad_generators,{a,#{b=>3}}}),
  334:     error_check("begin
  335:         X = 32, Y = 32, [{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3] && Y <- [4]] end.",
  336:     {bad_generators,{[2,3],[]}}),
  337:     error_check("begin
  338:         X = 32, Y = 32, [{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3] && Y:=_V <- #{1=>1}] end.",
  339:     {bad_generators,{[2,3],#{}}}),
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: zbc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     check(fun() ->
  344:                   <<3, 4, 5>>
  345:           end,
  346:           "begin
  347:         X = 32, Y = 32,
  348:           << <<(X+Y)/integer>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3>> && <<Y>> <= <<2,2,2>> >>
  349:               end.",
  350:         <<3, 4, 5>>),
  351:     check(fun() ->
  352:                   <<4,5,6,5,6,7,6,7,8>>
  353:           end,
  354:           "begin
  355:         X = 32, Y = 32, Z = 32,
  356:           << <<(X+Y+Z)/integer>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3>> && <<Y>> <= <<2,2,2>>, Z<-[1,2,3] >>
  357:               end.",
  358:         <<4,5,6,5,6,7,6,7,8>>),
  359:     check(fun() ->
  360:                   <<4, 5, 6>>
  361:           end,
  362:           "begin
  363:         L1 = <<1, 2, 3>>, L2 = <<1, 1, 1>>, L3 = <<2, 2, 2>>,
  364:           << <<(X+Y+Z)/integer>> || <<X>> <= L1 && <<Y>> <= L2 && <<Z>> <= L3 >>
  365:               end.",
  366:     <<4, 5, 6>>),
  367:     check(fun() ->
  368:          << <<(X+Y):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && Y <- [1,2] >> end,
  369:         "begin << <<(X+Y):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && Y <- [1,2] >> end.",
  370:         <<>>),
  371:     check(fun() ->
  372:          << <<(X+Y):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && <<Y>> <= <<1,2>> >> end,
  373:         "begin << <<(X+Y):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && <<Y>> <= <<1,2>> >> end.",
  374:         <<>>),
  375:     check(fun() ->
  376:          << <<(X+V):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && _K:=V <- #{a=>1,b=>2}>> end,
  377:         "begin << <<(X+V):64>>|| a=b=X <- [1,2] && _K:=V <- #{a=>1,b=>2}>> end.",
  378:         <<>>),
  379:     error_check("begin << <<(X+Y):8>> || <<X:b>> <= <<1,2>> && <<Y>> <= <<1,2>> >> end.",
  380:         {bad_generators,{<<>>,<<1,2>>}}),
  381:     error_check("begin << <<X>> || <<X>> <= a && Y <- [1]>> end.",{bad_generators,{a,[1]}}),
  382:     error_check("begin
  383:         X = 32, Y = 32,
  384:                 << <<(X+Y)/integer>> || X <- [1,2] && Y <- [1,2,3,4]>>
  385:                     end.",
  386:     {bad_generators,{[],[3,4]}}),
  387:     error_check("begin << <<X:8>> || X <- [1] && Y <- a && <<Z>> <= <<2>> >> end.",
  388:         {bad_generators,{[1], a, <<2>>}}),
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: zmc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  392:     check(fun() ->
  393:                   [{a,b,1,3}]
  394:           end,
  395:           "begin
  396:         M1 = #{a=>1}, M2 = #{b=>3},
  397:           [{K1, K2, V1, V2} || K1 := V1 <- M1 && K2 := V2 <- M2]
  398:           end.",
  399:     [{a,b,1,3}]),
  400:     check(fun() ->
  401:                   [A * 4 || A <- lists:seq(1, 50)]
  402:           end,
  403:           "begin
  404:         Seq = lists:seq(1, 50),
  405:           M1 = maps:iterator(#{X=>X || X <- Seq}, ordered),
  406:           M2 = maps:iterator(#{X=>X || X <- lists:seq(1,50)}, ordered),
  407:           [X+Y+Z+W || X := Y <- M1 && Z := W <- M2]
  408:           end.",
  409:     [A * 4 || A <- lists:seq(1, 50)]),
  410:     check(fun() ->
  411:                   [{A, A*3, A*2, A*4} || A <- lists:seq(1, 50)]
  412:           end,
  413:           "begin
  414:         Seq = lists:seq(1, 50),
  415:           M3 = maps:iterator(#{X=>X*3 || X <- Seq}, ordered),
  416:           M4 = maps:iterator(#{X*2=>X*4 || X <- Seq}, ordered),
  417:           [{X, Y, Z, W} || X := Y <- M3 && Z := W <- M4]
  418:           end.",
  419:     [{A, A*3, A*2, A*4} || A <- lists:seq(1, 50)]),
  420:     check(fun() ->
  421:                   #{K1 => V1+V2 || K1:=V1 <:- #{a=>1} && _K2:=V2 <- #{b=>3}}
  422:           end,
  423:           "begin
  424:         #{K1 => V1+V2 || K1:=V1 <- #{a=>1} && _K2:=V2 <- #{b=>3}}
  425:           end.",
  426:     #{a=>4}),
  427:     check(fun() ->
  428:                   #{K=>V || a := b <- #{x => y} && K := V <- #{x => y}}
  429:           end,
  430:           "begin
  431:         #{K=>V || a := b <- #{x => y} && K := V <- #{x => y}}
  432:           end.",
  433:     #{}),
  434:     error_check("begin
  435:         #{K1 => V1+V2 || K1:=V1 <- #{a=>1} &&
  436:                              _K2:=V2 <- maps:iterator(#{b=>3,c=>4}, ordered)}
  437:                 end.",
  438:     {bad_generators,{#{},#{c=>4}}}),
  439:     error_check("begin #{X=>Y || X <- [1] && Y <- a && K1:=V1 <- #{b=>3}} end.",
  440:         {bad_generators,{[1], a, #{b=>3}}}),
  441:     ok.
  442: 
  443: %% Simple cases, just to cover some code.
  444: simple_cases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  445:     check(fun() -> A = $C end, "A = $C.", $C),
  446:     %% check(fun() -> A = 3.14 end, "A = 3.14.", 3.14),
  447:     check(fun() -> self() ! a, A = receive a -> true end end,
  448: 	  "begin self() ! a, A = receive a -> true end end.",
  449: 	  true),
  450:     check(fun() -> c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,
  451: 		   receive b -> b end,
  452: 		   {messages, [a,c]} =
  453: 		       erlang:process_info(self(), messages),
  454: 		   c:flush() end,
  455: 	  "begin c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,"
  456: 	  "receive b -> b end,"
  457: 	  "{messages, [a,c]} ="
  458: 	  "     erlang:process_info(self(), messages), c:flush() end.",
  459: 	  ok),
  460:     check(fun() -> self() ! a, A = receive a -> true
  461: 				   after 0 -> false end end,
  462: 	  "begin self() ! a, A = receive a -> true"
  463: 	  "                      after 0 -> false end end.",
  464: 	  true),
  465:     check(fun() -> c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,
  466: 		   receive b -> b after 0 -> true end,
  467: 		   {messages, [a,c]} =
  468: 		       erlang:process_info(self(), messages),
  469: 		   c:flush() end,
  470: 	  "begin c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,"
  471: 	  "receive b -> b after 0 -> true end,"
  472: 	  "{messages, [a,c]} ="
  473: 	  "     erlang:process_info(self(), messages), c:flush() end.",
  474: 	  ok),
  475:     check(fun() -> receive _ -> true after 10 -> false end end,
  476: 	  "receive _ -> true after 10 -> false end.",
  477: 	  false),

  479: 	  "begin F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == F(3) end.",
  480: 	  true),
  481:     check(fun() -> F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == apply(F, [3]) end,
  482: 	  "begin F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == apply(F,[3]) end.",
  483: 	  true),
  484:     check(fun() -> catch throw(a) end, "catch throw(a).", a),
  485:     check(fun() -> catch a end, "catch a.", a),
  486:     check(fun() -> 4 == 3 end, "4 == 3.", false),
  487:     check(fun() -> not true end, "not true.", false),
  488:     check(fun() -> -3 end, "-3.", -3),

  865:                 "begin <<X:18/big-unsigned>> = <<34:18/big-unsigned>>,
  866:                        X end.",
  867:                 34),
  868:     check(fun() ->
  869:                         <<X:18/little-unsigned>> = <<34:18/little-unsigned>>,
  870:                         X end,
  871:                 "begin <<X:18/little-unsigned>> = <<34:18/little-unsigned>>,
  872:                        X end.",
  873:                 34),
  874:     check(fun() ->
  875:                         <<X:18/native-unsigned>> = <<34:18/native-unsigned>>,
  876:                         X end,
  877:                 "begin <<X:18/native-unsigned>> = <<34:18/native-unsigned>>,
  878:                        X end.",
  879:                 34),
  880:     check(fun() -> <<X:32/float-big>> = <<2.0:32/float-big>>, X end,
  881:                 "begin <<X:32/float-big>> = <<2.0:32/float-big>>,
  882:                         X end.",
  883:                 2.0),
  884:     check(fun() -> <<X:32/float-little>> = <<2.0:32/float-little>>,
  885:                          X end,
  886:                 "begin <<X:32/float-little>> = <<2.0:32/float-little>>,
  887:                         X end.",
  888:                 2.0),
  889:     check(fun() -> <<X:32/float-native>> = <<2.0:32/float-native>>,
  890:                          X end,
  891:                 "begin <<X:32/float-native>> = <<2.0:32/float-native>>,
  892:                         X end.",
  893:                 2.0),
  894: 
  895:     check(
  896:             fun() ->
  897:                     [X || <<"hej",X:8>> <= <<"hej",8,"san",9,"hej",17,"hej">>]
  898:             end,
  899:             "[X || <<\"hej\",X:8>> <=
  900:                         <<\"hej\",8,\"san\",9,\"hej\",17,\"hej\">>].",
  901:             [8,17]),
  902:     check(
  903:             fun() ->
  904:                     L = 8, << <<B:32>> || <<L:L,B:L>> <= <<16:8, 7:16>> >>
  905:             end,
  906:             "begin L = 8, << <<B:32>> || <<L:L,B:L>> <= <<16:8, 7:16>> >>
  907:              end.",
  908:             <<0,0,0,7>>),
  909:     %% Test the Value part of a binary segment.
  910:     %% "Old" bugs have been fixed (partial_eval is called on Value).
  911:     check(fun() -> [ 3 || <<17/float>> <= <<17.0/float>>] end,
  912:                 "[ 3 || <<17/float>> <= <<17.0/float>>].",
  913:                 [3]),
  914:     check(fun() -> [ 3 || <<17/float>> <- [<<17.0/float>>]] end,
  915:                 "[ 3 || <<17/float>> <- [<<17.0/float>>]].",
  916:                 [3]),
  917:     check(fun() -> [ X || <<17/float,X:3>> <= <<17.0/float,2:3>>] end,
  918:                 "[ X || <<17/float,X:3>> <= <<17.0/float,2:3>>].",
  919:                 [2]),
  920:     check(fun() ->
  921:                  [ foo || <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>> <= <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]
  922:                 end,
  923:                 "[ foo || <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>> <= <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>].",
  924:                 [foo]),
  925:     check(fun() ->
  926:                  [ foo || <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>> <- [<<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]]
  927:                 end,
  928:                "[ foo || <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>> <- [<<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]].",
  929:                 [foo]),
  930:     error_check("[ foo || <<(1 bsl 1024)/float>> <-
  931:                             [<<(1 bsl 1024)/float>>]].",
  932:                       badarg),
  933:     check(fun() ->
  934:                  [ foo || <<(1 bsl 1024)/float>> <- [<<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]]
  935:                 end,
  936:                 "[ foo || <<(1 bsl 1024)/float>> <-
  937:                             [<<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]].",
  938:                 []),
  939:     check(fun() ->
  940:                  [ foo || <<(1 bsl 1024)/float>> <= <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>]
  941:                 end,
  942:                 "[ foo || <<(1 bsl 1024)/float>> <=
  943:                             <<(1 bsl 1023)/float>>].",
  944:                 []),
  945:     check(fun() ->
  946:                         L = 8,
  947:                         [{L,B} || <<L:L,B:L/float>> <= <<32:8,7:32/float>>]
  948:                 end,
  949:                 "begin L = 8,
  950:                        [{L,B} || <<L:L,B:L/float>> <= <<32:8,7:32/float>>]
  951:                  end.",
  952:                 [{32,7.0}]),
  953:     check(fun() ->
  954:                         L = 8,
  955:                         [{L,B} || <<L:L,B:L/float>> <- [<<32:8,7:32/float>>]]
  956:                 end,
  957:                 "begin L = 8,
  958:                        [{L,B} || <<L:L,B:L/float>> <- [<<32:8,7:32/float>>]]
  959:                  end.",
  960:                 [{32,7.0}]),
  961:     check(fun() ->
  962:                         [foo || <<"s">> <= <<"st">>]
  963:                 end,
  964:                 "[foo || <<\"s\">> <= <<\"st\">>].",
  965:                 [foo]),

  967:                 "<<_:32>> = <<17:32>>.",
  968:                 <<17:32>>),

  970:                 "[foo || <<_:32>> <= <<17:32,20:32>>].",
  971:                 [foo,foo]),

  974:                 "<< <<X:32>> || X <- [1,2,3], X > 1 >>.",
  975:                 <<0,0,0,2,0,0,0,3>>),
  976:     error_check("[X || <<X>> <= [a,b]].",{bad_generator,[a,b]}),
  977:     ok.

  995: %% OTP-7550. Support for UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32.
  996: otp_7550(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  997: 
  998:     %% UTF-8.
  999:     check(
 1000: 	    fun() -> <<65>> = <<65/utf8>> end,
 1001: 	    "<<65>> = <<65/utf8>>.",
 1002: 	    <<65>>),
 1003:     check(
 1004: 	    fun() -> <<350/utf8>> = <<197,158>> end,
 1005: 	    "<<350/utf8>> = <<197,158>>.",
 1006: 	    <<197,158>>),
 1007:     check(
 1008: 	    fun() -> <<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>> = <<"bj\366rn"/utf8>> end,
 1009: 	    "<<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>> = <<\"bj\366rn\"/utf8>>.",
 1010: 	    <<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>>),
 1011: 
 1012:     %% UTF-16.
 1013:     check(
 1014: 	    fun() -> <<0,65>> = <<65/utf16>> end,
 1015: 	    "<<0,65>> = <<65/utf16>>.",
 1016: 	    <<0,65>>),
 1017:     check(
 1018: 	    fun() -> <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf16>> end,
 1019: 	    "<<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf16>>.",
 1020: 	    <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>),
 1021:     check(
 1022: 	    fun() -> <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> = <<16#12345/little-utf16>> end,
 1023: 	    "<<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> = <<16#12345/little-utf16>>.",
 1024: 	    <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>),
 1025: 
 1026:     check(
 1027: 	    fun() -> <<350/utf16>> = <<1,94>> end,
 1028: 	    "<<350/utf16>> = <<1,94>>.",
 1029: 	    <<1,94>>),
 1030:     check(
 1031: 	    fun() -> <<350/little-utf16>> = <<94,1>> end,
 1032: 	    "<<350/little-utf16>> = <<94,1>>.",
 1033: 	    <<94,1>>),
 1034:     check(
 1035: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/utf16>> = <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> end,
 1036: 	    "<<16#12345/utf16>> = <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>.",
 1037: 	    <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>),
 1038:     check(
 1039: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf16>> = <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> end,
 1040: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf16>> = <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>.",
 1041: 	    <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>),
 1042: 
 1043:     %% UTF-32.
 1044:     check(
 1045: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/utf32>> = <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> end,
 1046: 	    "<<16#12345/utf32>> = <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>.",
 1047: 	    <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>),
 1048:     check(
 1049: 	    fun() -> <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf32>> end,
 1050: 	    "<<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf32>>.",
 1051: 	    <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>),
 1052:     check(
 1053: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf32>> = <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>> end,
 1054: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf32>> = <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>.",
 1055: 	    <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>),
 1056:     check(
 1057: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf32>> end,
 1058: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf32>>.",
 1059: 	    <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>),
 1060: 
 1061:     %% Mixed.
 1062:     check(
 1063: 	    fun() -> <<16#41,16#12345/utf32,16#0391:16,16#2E:8>> end,
 1064: 	    "<<16#41,16#12345/utf32,16#0391:16,16#2E:8>>.",
 1065: 	    <<16#41,16#00,16#01,16#23,16#45,16#03,16#91,16#2E>>),
 1066:     ok.

 1093:             ok),

 1311:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6},
 1312:                      eval_bits,eval_bits,erl_eval]),
 1313:     backtrace_check("<<100:8/foo>>.",
 1314:                     {undefined_bittype,foo},
 1315:                     [{eval_bits,make_bit_type,4},eval_bits,
 1316:                      eval_bits,eval_bits],
 1317:                     none, none),
 1318:     backtrace_check("B = <<\"foo\">>, <<B/binary-unit:7>>.",
 1319:                     badarg,
 1320:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6},
 1321:                      eval_bits,eval_bits,erl_eval],
 1322:                     none, none),
 1323: 
 1324:     %% eval_bits with error info
 1325:     {error_info, #{cause := _, override_segment_position := 1}} =
 1326:         error_info_catch("<<100:8/bitstring>>.", badarg),
 1327: 
 1328:     {error_info, #{cause := _, override_segment_position := 2}} =
 1329:         error_info_catch("<<0:8, 100:8/bitstring>>.", badarg),
 1330: 
 1331:     ok.
 1332: 
 1333: simple() ->
 1334:     A = simple1(),
 1335:     {A}.
 1336: 
 1337: simple1() ->
 1338:     %% If the compiler could see that this function would always
 1339:     %% throw an error exception, it would rewrite simple() like this:
 1340:     %%
 1341:     %%   simple() -> simple1().
 1342:     %%
 1343:     %% That would change the stacktrace. To prevent the compiler from
 1344:     %% doing that optimization, we must obfuscate the code.
 1345:     case get(a_key_that_is_not_defined) of
 1346:         undefined -> erlang:error(simple);
 1347:         WillNeverHappen -> WillNeverHappen
 1348:     end.
 1349: 
 1350: custom_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1351:     EFH = {value, fun custom_stacktrace_eval_handler/3},
 1352: 
 1353:     backtrace_check("1 + atom.", badarith,
 1354:                     [{erlang,'+',[1,atom]}, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1355:     backtrace_check("\n1 + atom.", badarith,
 1356:                     [{erlang,'+',[1,atom]}, mystack(2)], none, EFH),
 1357: 
 1358:     backtrace_check("lists:flatten(atom).", function_clause,
 1359:                     [{lists,flatten,[atom]}, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1360: 
 1361:     backtrace_check("invalid andalso true.", {badarg, invalid},
 1362:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1363:     backtrace_check("invalid orelse true.", {badarg, invalid},
 1364:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1365: 
 1366:     backtrace_check("invalid = valid.", {badmatch, valid},
 1367:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1368: 
 1369:     backtrace_check("1:2.", {badexpr, ':'},
 1370:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1371: 
 1372:     backtrace_check("Unknown.", {unbound, 'Unknown'},
 1373:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1374: 
 1375:     backtrace_check("#unknown{}.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1376:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1377:     backtrace_check("#unknown{foo=bar}.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1378:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1379:     backtrace_check("#unknown.index.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1380:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1381: 
 1382:     backtrace_check("foo(1, 2).", undef,
 1383:                     [{erl_eval, foo, 2}, erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1384: 
 1385:     fun() ->
 1386:             {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_Fun, []}}, BT}} =
 1387:                 (catch parse_and_run("fun(A) -> A end().", none, EFH)),
 1388:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1389:     end(),
 1390: 
 1391:     fun() ->
 1392:             {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_Fun, []}}, BT}} =
 1393:                 (catch parse_and_run("fun F(A) -> A end().", none, EFH)),
 1394:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1395:     end(),
 1396: 
 1397:     backtrace_check("[X || X <- 1].", {bad_generator, 1},
 1398:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1399:     backtrace_check("[X || <<X>> <= 1].", {bad_generator, 1},
 1400:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1401:     backtrace_check("<<X || X <- 1>>.", {bad_generator, 1},
 1402:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1403:     backtrace_check("<<X || <<X>> <= 1>>.", {bad_generator, 1},
 1404:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1405: 
 1406:     backtrace_check("if false -> true end.", if_clause,
 1407:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1408:     backtrace_check("case 0 of 1 -> true end.", {case_clause, 0},
 1409:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1410:     backtrace_check("try 0 of 1 -> true after ok end.", {try_clause, 0},
 1411:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1412: 
 1413:     backtrace_check("fun(0) -> 1 end(1).", function_clause,
 1414:                     [{erl_eval,'-inside-an-interpreted-fun-', [1]}, erl_eval, mystack(1)],
 1415:                     none, EFH),
 1416:     backtrace_check("fun F(0) -> 1 end(1).", function_clause,
 1417:                     [{erl_eval,'-inside-an-interpreted-fun-', [1]}, erl_eval, mystack(1)],
 1418:                     none, EFH),
 1419: 
 1420:     fun() ->
 1421:             {'EXIT', {{illegal_pattern,_}, BT}} =
 1422:                 (catch parse_and_run("make_ref() = 1.", none, EFH)),
 1423:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1424:     end(),
 1425: 
 1426:     %% eval_bits
 1427:     backtrace_check("<<100:8/bitstring>>.",
 1428:                     badarg,
 1429:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6}, mystack(1)],
 1430:                     none, EFH),
 1431:     backtrace_check("<<100:8/foo>>.",
 1432:                     {undefined_bittype,foo},
 1433:                     [{eval_bits,make_bit_type,4}, mystack(1)],
 1434:                     none, EFH),
 1435:     backtrace_check("B = <<\"foo\">>, <<B/binary-unit:7>>.",
 1436:                     badarg,
 1437:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6}, mystack(1)],
 1438:                     none, EFH),
 1439: 
 1440:     ok.
 1441: 
 1442: mystack(Line) ->
 1443:     {my_module, my_function, 0, [{file, "evaluator"}, {line, Line}]}.
 1444: 
 1445: custom_stacktrace_eval_handler(Ann, FunOrModFun, Args) ->
 1446:     try
 1447:         case FunOrModFun of
 1448:             {Mod, Fun} -> apply(Mod, Fun, Args);
 1449:             Fun -> apply(Fun, Args)
 1450:         end
 1451:     catch
 1452:         Kind:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 1453:             %% Take everything up to the evaluation function
 1454:             Pruned =
 1455:                 lists:takewhile(fun
 1456:                   ({erl_eval_SUITE,backtrace_check,5,_}) -> false;
 1457:                   (_) -> true
 1458:                 end, Stacktrace),
 1459:             %% Now we prune any shared code path from erl_eval
 1460:             {current_stacktrace, Current} =
 1461:                 erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace),
 1462:             Reversed = drop_common(lists:reverse(Current), lists:reverse(Pruned)),
 1463:             Location = [{file, "evaluator"}, {line, erl_anno:line(Ann)}],
 1464:             %% Add our file+line information at the bottom
 1465:             Custom = lists:reverse([{my_module, my_function, 0, Location} | Reversed]),
 1466:             erlang:raise(Kind, Reason, Custom)
 1467:     end.
 1468: 
 1469: drop_common([H | T1], [H | T2]) -> drop_common(T1, T2);
 1470: drop_common([H | T1], T2) -> drop_common(T1, T2);
 1471: drop_common([], [{?MODULE, custom_stacktrace_eval_handler, _, _} | T2]) -> T2;
 1472: drop_common([], T2) -> T2.
 1473: 
 1474: %% Simple cases, just to cover some code.
 1475: funs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1476:     do_funs(none, none),
 1477:     do_funs(lfh(), none),
 1478:     do_funs(none, efh()),
 1479:     do_funs(lfh(), efh()),
 1480:     do_funs(none, ann_efh()),
 1481:     do_funs(lfh(), ann_efh()),
 1482: 
 1483:     error_check("nix:foo().", {access_not_allowed,nix}, lfh(), efh()),
 1484:     error_check("nix:foo().", {access_not_allowed,nix}, lfh(), ann_efh()),
 1485:     error_check("bar().", undef, none, none),
 1486: 
 1487:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1488:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1489:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1490:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1491: 		0, ['F1'], lfh(), none),
 1492: 
 1493:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1494:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1495:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1496:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1497: 		0, ['F1'], lfh_value(), none),
 1498: 
 1499:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1500:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1501:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1502:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1503: 		0, ['F1'], lfh_value_extra(), none),
 1504: 
 1505:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1506:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1507:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1508:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1509: 		0, ['F1'], {?MODULE,local_func_value}, none),
 1510:     %% This is not documented, and only for backward compatibility (good!).
 1511:     B0 = erl_eval:new_bindings(),
 1512:     check(fun() -> is_function(?MODULE:count_down_fun()) end,
 1513:                 "begin is_function(count_down_fun()) end.",
 1514:                 true, [], {?MODULE,local_func,[B0]},none),
 1515: 
 1516:     EF = fun({timer,sleep}, As) when length(As) == 1 -> exit({got_it,sleep});
 1517:             ({M,F}, As) -> apply(M, F, As)
 1518:          end,
 1519:     EFH = {value, EF},
 1520:     error_check("apply(timer, sleep, [1]).", got_it, none, EFH),
 1521:     error_check("begin F = fun(T) -> timer:sleep(T) end,F(1) end.",
 1522:                       got_it, none, EFH),
 1523: 
 1524:     AnnEF = fun(1, {timer,sleep}, As) when length(As) == 1 -> exit({got_it,sleep});
 1525:                (1, {M,F}, As) -> apply(M, F, As)
 1526:          end,
 1527:     AnnEFH = {value, AnnEF},
 1528:     error_check("apply(timer, sleep, [1]).", got_it, none, AnnEFH),
 1529:     error_check("begin F = fun(T) -> timer:sleep(T) end,F(1) end.",
 1530:                       got_it, none, AnnEFH),
 1531: 
 1532:     error_check("fun a:b/0().", undef),
 1533: 
 1534:     MaxArgs = 20,
 1535:     [true] =
 1536:         lists:usort([run_many_args(SAs) || SAs <- many_args(MaxArgs)]),
 1537:     {'EXIT',{{argument_limit,_},_}} =
 1538:         (catch run_many_args(many_args1(MaxArgs+1))),
 1539: 
 1540:     check(fun() -> M = lists, F = fun M:reverse/1,
 1541: 			 [1,2] = F([2,1]), ok end,
 1542: 		"begin M = lists, F = fun M:reverse/1,"
 1543: 		" [1,2] = F([2,1]), ok end.",
 1544: 		ok),
 1545: 
 1546:     %% Test that {M,F} is not accepted as a fun.
 1547:     error_check("{" ?MODULE_STRING ",module_info}().",
 1548: 		{badfun,{?MODULE,module_info}}),
 1549: 
 1550:     %% Test defining and calling a fun based on an auto-imported BIF.
 1551:     check(fun() ->
 1552:                   F = fun is_binary/1,
 1553:                   true = F(<<>>),
 1554:                   false = F(a)
 1555:           end,
 1556:           ~S"""
 1557:            F = fun is_binary/1,
 1558:            true = F(<<>>),
 1559:            false = F(a).
 1560:            """,
 1561:           false, ['F'], lfh(), none),
 1562: 
 1563:     %% Test defining and calling a local fun defined in the shell.
 1564:     check(fun() ->
 1565:                   D = fun my_div/2,
 1566:                   3 = D(15, 5)
 1567:           end,
 1568:           ~S"""
 1569:            D = fun my_div/2,
 1570:            3 = D(15, 5).
 1571:            """,
 1572:           3, ['D'], lfh(), efh()),
 1573: 
 1574:     ok.
 1575: 
 1576: my_div(A, B) ->
 1577:     A div B.
 1578: 
 1579: run_many_args({S, As}) ->
 1580:     apply(eval_string(S), As) =:= As.
 1581: 
 1582: many_args(N) ->
 1583:     [many_args1(I) || I <- lists:seq(1, N)].
 1584: 
 1585: many_args1(N) ->
 1586:     F = fun(L, P) ->
 1587:                 tl(lists:flatten([","++P++integer_to_list(E) || E <- L]))
 1588:         end,
 1589:     L = lists:seq(1, N),
 1590:     T = F(L, "V"),
 1591:     S = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("fun(~s) -> [~s] end.", [T, T])),
 1592:     {S, L}.
 1593: 
 1594: do_funs(LFH, EFH) ->
 1595:     %% LFH is not really used by these examples...
 1596: 
 1597:     %% These tests do not prove that tail recursive functions really
 1598:     %% work (that the process does not grow); one should also run them
 1599:     %% manually with 1000 replaced by 1000000.
 1600: 
 1601:     M = atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 1602:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1603:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1604:                 concat(["begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> ", M,
 1605:                         ":count_down(F, N) end, F1(F1,1000) end."]),
 1606: 		0, ['F1'], LFH, EFH),
 1607:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> apply(?MODULE,count_down,[F,N])
 1608:                               end, F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1609:                 concat(["begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> apply(", M,
 1610:                         ",count_down,[F, N]) end, F1(F1,1000) end."]),
 1611: 		0, ['F1'], LFH, EFH),
 1612:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 -> apply(F,[F,N-1]);
 1613:                                 (_F,0) -> ok end,
 1614:                          F(F, 1000)
 1615:                 end,
 1616:                 "begin F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 -> apply(F,[F,N-1]);"
 1617:                              "(_F,0) -> ok end,"
 1618:                        "F(F, 1000) end.",
 1619:                 ok, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1620:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 ->
 1621:                                      apply(erlang,apply,[F,[F,N-1]]);
 1622:                                 (_F,0) -> ok end,
 1623:                          F(F, 1000)
 1624:                 end,
 1625:                 "begin F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 ->"
 1626:                                    "apply(erlang,apply,[F,[F,N-1]]);"
 1627:                              "(_F,0) -> ok end,"
 1628:                        "F(F, 1000) end.",
 1629:                 ok, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1630:     check(fun() -> F = count_down_fun(),
 1631:                          SF = fun(SF, F1, N) -> F(SF, F1, N) end,
 1632:                          SF(SF, F, 1000) end,
 1633:                 concat(["begin F = ", M, ":count_down_fun(),"
 1634:                         "SF = fun(SF, F1, N) -> F(SF, F1, N) end,"
 1635:                         "SF(SF, F, 1000) end."]),
 1636:                 ok, ['F','SF'], LFH, EFH),
 1637: 
 1638: 
 1639:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> A = 1+X, {X,A} end,
 1640:                          true = {2,3} == F(2) end,
 1641:                 "begin F = fun(X) -> A = 1+X, {X,A} end,
 1642:                        true = {2,3} == F(2) end.", true, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1643:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> erlang:'+'(X,2) end,
 1644: 		   true = 3 == F(1) end,
 1645: 	  "begin F = fun(X) -> erlang:'+'(X,2) end,"
 1646: 	  "      true = 3 == F(1) end.", true, ['F'],
 1647: 	  LFH, EFH),
 1648:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> byte_size(X) end,
 1649:                          ?MODULE:do_apply(F,<<"hej">>) end,
 1650:                 concat(["begin F = fun(X) -> size(X) end,",
 1651:                         M,":do_apply(F,<<\"hej\">>) end."]),
 1652:                 3, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1653: 
 1654:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(X, Z) -> {X,Z} end,
 1655:                          Z = 5,
 1656:                          F2 = fun(X, Y) -> F1(Z,{X,Y}) end,
 1657:                          F3 = fun(X, Y) -> {a,F1(Z,{X,Y})} end,
 1658:                          {5,{x,y}} = F2(x,y),
 1659:                          {a,{5,{y,x}}} = F3(y,x),
 1660:                          {5,{5,y}} = F2(Z,y),
 1661:                          true = {5,{x,5}} == F2(x,Z) end,
 1662:                 "begin F1 = fun(X, Z) -> {X,Z} end,
 1663:                        Z = 5,
 1664:                        F2 = fun(X, Y) -> F1(Z,{X,Y}) end,
 1665:                        F3 = fun(X, Y) -> {a,F1(Z,{X,Y})} end,
 1666:                        {5,{x,y}} = F2(x,y),
 1667:                        {a,{5,{y,x}}} = F3(y,x),
 1668:                        {5,{5,y}} = F2(Z,y),
 1669:                        true = {5,{x,5}} == F2(x,Z) end.",
 1670:                 true, ['F1','Z','F2','F3'], LFH, EFH),
 1671:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> byte_size(X) end,
 1672:                          F2 = fun(Y) -> F(Y) end,
 1673:                          ?MODULE:do_apply(F2,<<"hej">>) end,
 1674:                 concat(["begin F = fun(X) -> size(X) end,",
 1675:                         "F2 = fun(Y) -> F(Y) end,",
 1676:                         M,":do_apply(F2,<<\"hej\">>) end."]),
 1677:                 3, ['F','F2'], LFH, EFH),
 1678:     check(fun() -> Z = 5, F = fun(X) -> {Z,X} end,
 1679:                          F2 = fun(Z) -> F(Z) end, F2(3) end,
 1680:                 "begin Z = 5, F = fun(X) -> {Z,X} end,
 1681:                        F2 = fun(Z) -> F(Z) end, F2(3) end.",
 1682:                 {5,3},['F','F2','Z'], LFH, EFH),
 1683:     check(fun() -> F = fun(Z) -> Z end,
 1684:                          F2 = fun(X) -> F(X), Z = {X,X}, Z end,
 1685:                          {1,1} = F2(1), Z = 7, Z end,
 1686:                 "begin F = fun(Z) -> Z end,
 1687:                        F2 = fun(X) -> F(X), Z = {X,X}, Z end,
 1688:                        {1,1} = F2(1), Z = 7, Z end.", 7, ['F','F2','Z'],
 1689:                 LFH, EFH),
 1690:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F, N) -> [?MODULE:count_down(F,N) || X <-[1]]
 1691:                              end, F(F,2) end,
 1692:                 concat(["begin F = fun(F, N) -> [", M,
 1693:                        ":count_down(F,N) || X <-[1]] end, F(F,2) end."]),
 1694:                 [[[0]]], ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1695:     ok.
 1696: 
 1697: count_down(F, N) when N > 0 ->
 1698:     F(F, N-1);
 1699: count_down(_F, N) ->
 1700:     N.
 1701: 
 1702: count_down_fun() ->
 1703:     fun(SF,F,N) when N > 0 -> SF(SF,F,N-1);
 1704:        (_SF,_F,_N) -> ok
 1705:     end.
 1706: 
 1707: do_apply(F, V) ->
 1708:     F(V).
 1709: 
 1710: lfh() ->
 1711:     {eval, fun(F, As, Bs) -> local_func(F, As, Bs) end}.
 1712: 
 1713: local_func(F, As0, Bs0) when is_atom(F) ->
 1714:     {As,Bs} = erl_eval:expr_list(As0, Bs0, lfh()),
 1715:     case erlang:function_exported(?MODULE, F, length(As)) of
 1716: 	true ->
 1717: 	    {value,apply(?MODULE, F, As),Bs};
 1718: 	false ->
 1719: 	    {value,apply(shell_default, F, As),Bs}
 1720:     end.
 1721: 
 1722: lfh_value_extra() ->
 1723:     %% Not documented.
 1724:     {value, fun(F, As, a1, a2) -> local_func_value(F, As) end, [a1, a2]}.
 1725: 
 1726: lfh_value() ->
 1727:     {value, fun(F, As) -> local_func_value(F, As) end}.
 1728: 
 1729: local_func_value(F, As) when is_atom(F) ->
 1730:     case erlang:function_exported(?MODULE, F, length(As)) of
 1731: 	true ->
 1732: 	    apply(?MODULE, F, As);
 1733: 	false ->
 1734: 	    apply(shell_default, F, As)
 1735:     end.
 1736: 
 1737: efh() ->
 1738:     {value, fun(F, As) -> external_func(F, As) end}.
 1739: 
 1740: ann_efh() ->
 1741:     {value, fun(_Ann, F, As) -> external_func(F, As) end}.
 1742: 
 1743: external_func({M,_}, _As) when M == nix ->
 1744:     exit({{access_not_allowed,M},[mfa]});
 1745: external_func(F, As) when is_function(F) ->
 1746:     apply(F, As);
 1747: external_func({M,F}, As) ->
 1748:     apply(M, F, As).
 1749: 
 1750: 
 1751: 
 1752: %% Test try-of-catch-after-end statement.
 1753: try_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1754:     %% Match in of with catch
 1755:     check(fun() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2 catch _:_ -> 3 end end,
 1756: 		"try 1 of 1 -> 2 catch _:_ -> 3 end.", 2),
 1757:     check(fun() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end end,
 1758: 		"try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.", 2),
 1759:     check(fun() -> try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end end,
 1760: 		"try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.", 4),
 1761:     %% Just after
 1762:     check(fun () -> X = try 1 after put(try_catch, 2) end,
 1763: 			  {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1764: 		"begin X = try 1 after put(try_catch, 2) end, "
 1765: 		"{X,get(try_catch)} end.", {1,2}),
 1766:     %% Match in of with after
 1767:     check(fun() -> X = try 1 of 1 -> 2 after put(try_catch, 3) end,
 1768: 			 {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1769: 		"begin X = try 1 of 1 -> 2 after put(try_catch, 3) end, "
 1770: 		"{X,get(try_catch)} end.", {2,3}),
 1771:     check(fun() -> X = try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4

 1778: 			     after put(try_catch, 5) end,

 2194:     check(fun() -> X = 32, #{X => X*X || X <- [1,2,3]} end,
 2195: 	  "begin X = 32, #{X => X*X || X <- [1,2,3]} end.",
 2196: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2197:     check(fun() ->
 2198:                   K = V = none,
 2199:                   #{K => V*V || K := V <- #{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3}}
 2200:           end,
 2201:           "begin K = V = none, #{K => V*V || K := V <- #{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3}} end.",
 2202: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2203:     check(fun() ->
 2204:                   #{K => V*V || K := V <- maps:iterator(#{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3})}
 2205:           end,
 2206:           "#{K => V*V || K := V <- maps:iterator(#{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3})}.",
 2207: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2208:     check(fun() -> << <<K:8,V:24>> || K := V <- #{42 => 7777} >> end,
 2209:           "<< <<K:8,V:24>> || K := V <- #{42 => 7777} >>.",
 2210: 	  <<42:8,7777:24>>),
 2211:     check(fun() -> [X || X := X <- #{a => 1, b => b}] end,
 2212:           "[X || X := X <- #{a => 1, b => b}].",
 2213: 	  [b]),
 2214: 
 2215:     error_check("[K+V || K := V <- a].", {bad_generator,a}),
 2216:     error_check("[K+V || K := V <- [-1|#{}]].", {bad_generator,[-1|#{}]}),
 2217: 
 2218:     ok.

 2220: strict_generators(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2221:     %% Basic scenario for each comprehension and generator type
 2222:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]] end,
 2223:           "[X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]].",
 2224:           [2,3,4]),
 2225:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>] end,
 2226:           "[X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>].",
 2227:           [2,3,4]),
 2228:     check(fun() -> [X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}] end,
 2229:           "[X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}].",
 2230:           [2,12]),
 2231:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3]>> end,
 2232:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3]>>.",
 2233:           <<2,3,4>>),
 2234:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>> >> end,
 2235:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>> >>.",
 2236:           <<2,3,4>>),
 2237:     check(fun() -> << <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4} >> end,
 2238:           "<< <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4} >>.",
 2239:           <<2,12>>),
 2240:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]} end,
 2241:           "#{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]}.",
 2242:           #{1 => 2, 2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2243:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>} end,
 2244:           "#{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>}.",
 2245:           #{1 => 2, 2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2246:     check(fun() -> #{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}} end,
 2247:           "#{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}}.",
 2248:           #{2 => 4, 4 => 8}),
 2249: 
 2250:     %% A failing guard following a strict generator is ok
 2251:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1] end,
 2252:           "[X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1].",
 2253:           [3,4]),
 2254:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1] end,
 2255:           "[X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1].",
 2256:           [3,4]),
 2257:     check(fun() -> [X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1] end,
 2258:           "[X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1].",
 2259:           [12]),
 2260:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1>> end,
 2261:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1>>.",
 2262:           <<3,4>>),
 2263:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1 >> end,
 2264:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1 >>.",
 2265:           <<3,4>>),
 2266:     check(fun() -> << <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1 >> end,
 2267:           "<< <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1 >>.",
 2268:           <<12>>),
 2269:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1} end,
 2270:           "#{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1}.",
 2271:           #{2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2272:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1} end,
 2273:           "#{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1}.",
 2274:           #{2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2275:     check(fun() -> #{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1} end,
 2276:           "#{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1}.",
 2277:           #{4 => 8}),
 2278: 
 2279:     %% Non-matching elements cause a badmatch error
 2280:     error_check("[X || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}]].",
 2281:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2282:     error_check("[X || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>>].",
 2283:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2284:     error_check("[X || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok}].",
 2285:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2286:     error_check("<< <<X>> || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}] >>.",
 2287:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2288:     error_check("<< <<X>> || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>> >>.",
 2289:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2290:     error_check("<< <<X>> || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok} >>.",
 2291:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2292:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}]}.",
 2293:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2294:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>>}.",
 2295:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2296:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok}}.",
 2297:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2298: 
 2299:     %% Binary generators don't allow unused bits at the end either
 2300:     error_check("[X || <<X:3>> <:= <<0>>].",
 2301:                 {badmatch,<<0:2>>}),
 2302:     error_check("[Y || <<X, Y:X>> <:= <<8,1,9,2>>].",
 2303:                 {badmatch,<<9,2>>}),
 2304:     ok.
 2305: 
 2306: binary_skip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2307:     check(fun() -> X = 32, [X || <<X:64/float>> <= <<-1:64, 0:64, 0:64, 0:64>>] end,
 2308: 	  "begin X = 32, [X || <<X:64/float>> <= <<-1:64, 0:64, 0:64, 0:64>>] end.",
 2309: 	  [+0.0,+0.0,+0.0]),
 2310:     check(fun() -> X = 32, [X || <<X:64/float>> <= <<0:64, -1:64, 0:64, 0:64>>] end,
 2311: 	  "begin X = 32, [X || <<X:64/float>> <= <<0:64, -1:64, 0:64, 0:64>>] end.",
 2312: 	  [+0.0,+0.0,+0.0]),
 2313:     check(fun() -> [a || <<0:64/float>> <= <<0:64, 1:64, 0:64, 0:64>> ] end,
 2314: 	  "begin [a || <<0:64/float>> <= <<0:64, 1:64, 0:64, 0:64>> ] end.",
 2315: 	  [a,a,a]),
 2316:     ok.
 2317: 
 2318: %% Check the string in different contexts: as is; in fun; from compiled code.
 2319: check(F, String, Result) ->
 2320:     check1(F, String, Result),
 2321:     FunString = concat(["fun() -> ", no_final_dot(String), " end(). "]),
 2322:     check1(F, FunString, Result),
 2323:     CompileString = concat(["hd(lists:map(fun(_) -> ", no_final_dot(String),
 2324:                             " end, [foo])). "]),
 2325:     check1(F, CompileString, Result).
 2326: 
 2327: check1(F, String, Result) ->
 2328:     Result = F(),
 2329:     Expr = parse_expr(String),
 2330:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, []) of
 2331:         {value, Result, Bs} when is_list(Bs) ->
 2332:             ok;
 2333:         Other1 ->
 2334:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2335:     end,
 2336:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, #{}) of
 2337:         {value, Result, MapBs} when is_map(MapBs) ->
 2338:             ok;
 2339:         Other2 ->
 2340:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2341:     end.
 2342: 
 2343: check(F, String, Result, BoundVars, LFH, EFH) ->
 2344:     Result = F(),
 2345:     Exprs = parse_exprs(String),
 2346:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, [], LFH, EFH) of
 2347:         {value, Result, Bs} ->
 2348:             %% We just assume that Bs is an orddict...
 2349:             Keys = orddict:fetch_keys(Bs),
 2350:             case sort(BoundVars) == sort(Keys) of
 2351:                 true ->
 2352:                     ok;
 2353:                 false ->
 2354:                     ct:fail({check, BoundVars, Keys})
 2355:             end,
 2356:             ok;
 2357:         Other1 ->
 2358:             ct:fail({check, Other1, Result})
 2359:     end,
 2360:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, #{}, LFH, EFH) of
 2361:         {value, Result, MapBs} ->
 2362:             MapKeys = maps:keys(MapBs),
 2363:             case sort(BoundVars) == sort(MapKeys) of
 2364:                 true ->
 2365:                     ok;
 2366:                 false ->
 2367:                     ct:fail({check, BoundVars, MapKeys})
 2368:             end,
 2369:             ok;
 2370:         Other2 ->
 2371:             ct:fail({check, Other2, Result})
 2372:     end.
 2373: 
 2374: error_check(String, Result) ->
 2375:     Expr = parse_expr(String),
 2376:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, []) of
 2377:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2378:             ok;
 2379:         Other1 ->
 2380:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2381:     end,
 2382:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, #{}) of
 2383:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2384:             ok;
 2385:         Other2 ->
 2386:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2387:     end.
 2388: 
 2389: error_check(String, Result, LFH, EFH) ->
 2390:     Exprs = parse_exprs(String),
 2391:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, [], LFH, EFH) of
 2392:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2393:             ok;
 2394:         Other1 ->
 2395:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2396:     end,
 2397:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, #{}, LFH, EFH) of
 2398:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2399:             ok;
 2400:         Other2 ->
 2401:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2402:     end.
 2403: 
 2404: backtrace_check(String, Result, Backtrace) ->
 2405:     case catch parse_and_run(String) of
 2406:         {'EXIT', {Result, BT}} ->
 2407:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2408:         Other ->
 2409:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2410:     end.
 2411: 
 2412: backtrace_check(String, Result, Backtrace, LFH, EFH) ->
 2413:     case catch parse_and_run(String, LFH, EFH) of
 2414:         {'EXIT', {Result, BT}} ->
 2415:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2416:         Other ->
 2417:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2418:     end.
 2419: 
 2420: remove_error_info([{M, F, As, Info} | T]) ->
 2421:     [{M, F, As, lists:keydelete(error_info, 1, Info)} | T].
 2422: 
 2423: backtrace_catch(String, Result, Backtrace) ->
 2424:     case parse_and_run(String) of
 2425:         {value, {'EXIT', {Result, BT}}, _Bindings} ->
 2426:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2427:         Other ->
 2428:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2429:     end.
 2430: 
 2431: error_info_catch(String, Result) ->
 2432:     case catch parse_and_run(String) of
 2433:         {'EXIT', {Result, [{_, _, _, Info}|_]}} ->
 2434:             lists:keyfind(error_info, 1, Info);
 2435:         Other ->
 2436:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2437:     end.
 2438: 
 2439: check_backtrace([B1|Backtrace], [B2|BT]) ->
 2440:     case {B1, B2} of
 2441:         {M, {M,_,_,_}} ->
 2442:             ok;
 2443:         {{M,F,A}, {M,F,A,_}} ->
 2444:             ok;
 2445:         {B, B} ->
 2446:             ok
 2447:     end,
 2448:     check_backtrace(Backtrace, BT);
 2449: check_backtrace([], _) ->
 2450:     ok.
 2451: 
 2452: eval_string(String) ->
 2453:     {value, Result, _} = parse_and_run(String),
 2454:     Result.
 2455: 
 2456: parse_expr(String) ->
 2457:     Tokens = erl_scan_string(String),
 2458:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 2459:     Expr.
 2460: 
 2461: parse_exprs(String) ->
 2462:     Tokens = erl_scan_string(String),
 2463:     {ok, Exprs} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 2464:     Exprs.
 2465: 
 2466: erl_scan_string(String) ->
 2467:     %% FIXME: When the experimental features EEP has been implemented, we should
 2468:     %% dig out all keywords defined in all features.
 2469:     ResWordFun =
 2470:         fun('maybe') -> true;
 2471:            ('else') -> true;
 2472:            (Other) -> erl_scan:reserved_word(Other)
 2473:         end,
 2474:     {ok,Tokens,_} = erl_scan:string(String, 1, [{reserved_word_fun,ResWordFun}]),
 2475:     Tokens.
 2476: 
 2477: parse_and_run(String) ->
 2478:     erl_eval:expr(parse_expr(String), []).
 2479: 
 2480: parse_and_run(String, LFH, EFH) ->
 2481:     erl_eval:exprs(parse_exprs(String), [], LFH, EFH).
 2482: 
 2483: no_final_dot(S) ->
 2484:     case lists:reverse(S) of
 2485:         " ." ++ R -> lists:reverse(R);
 2486:         "." ++ R -> lists:reverse(R);
 2487:         _ -> S
 2488:     end.
